title: How to Use Caraway Seeds

steps.headline: Use caraway seeds to improve the taste of certain vegetables.
steps.description: Put a teaspoon of caraway seeds into a piece of muslin. Tie the muslin with string. Place this bag into the boiling water for cabbage and cauliflower. The caraway seeds will add flavour, as well as lessening the odour of the vegetables during cooking.

steps.headline: Sprinkle over roasted vegetables.
steps.description: Potatoes and sweet potatoes are good choices.

steps.headline: Add caraway seeds to baked apples.
steps.description: They will enhance the flavour. Caraway seeds can even be sprinkled on raw apple pieces for a tasty snack.

steps.headline: Use caraway seeds with baked goods.
steps.description: Caraway seeds make an ideal topping on rye breads and spice cakes, as used in traditional Scandinavian cooking. Try wikiHow's caraway cake recipe.

steps.headline: Mix caraway seeds into cheese dips.

text: Use caraway seeds to improve the taste of certain vegetables. Put a teaspoon of caraway seeds into a piece of muslin. Tie the muslin with string. Place this bag into the boiling water for cabbage and cauliflower. The caraway seeds will add flavour, as well as lessening the odour of the vegetables during cooking. Sprinkle over roasted vegetables. Potatoes and sweet potatoes are good choices. Add caraway seeds to baked apples. They will enhance the flavour. Caraway seeds can even be sprinkled on raw apple pieces for a tasty snack. Use caraway seeds with baked goods. Caraway seeds make an ideal topping on rye breads and spice cakes, as used in traditional Scandinavian cooking. Try wikiHow's caraway cake recipe. Mix caraway seeds into cheese dips. They make an ideal combination.
